Stochastic Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for Stochastic:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A stochastic variable.

This class implements a stochastic process, either has a simple process, or as a function of another variable. It can run in active mode - the ()-operator will then forward it by one step; or in passive mode - in which case the ()-operator will only retrieve value or delta. The value of a stochastic variable changes with each time step - either when a () operator or the d() function is called. All forms of stochastic variables should inherit from this class.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Stochastic::step (  )  [inline, virtual]

Proceed one time step.

This method can be overridden to implement the proceeding of one time step. This makes new information available at the current time. (See also step()). The default just writes dNextValue into dCurrentValue.

Implements TimeDependent.

Reimplemented in IfNeuron, Noise, NoiseSource, and ComplexSynapse.

virtual void Stochastic::next (  )  [inline, virtual]

Calculate next value (preparing next step).

This method should be overridden to implement the calculation of the next value, using information wich is available at the current time.

Implements TimeDependent.

Reimplemented in Covariation, DifferentialEquation, IfNeuron, Noise, NoiseSource, Product, Square, Conductance, Poisson, Synapse, ComplexSynapse, ThetaMembrane, ThetaStimulus, ThetaNeuron, and Wiener.

virtual double Stochastic::getIncrement (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the increment.

This is the difference to the next time step. The difference to operator()() is that it never proceeds the object's time.

virtual double Stochastic::getCurrentValue (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the value of the process.

This is the current value. The difference to operator()(double) is that it never proceeds the object's time. Implementing this function is compulsary.

virtual double Stochastic::getNextValue (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the next value of the process.

This is the next value. This is the same as getCurrentValue() + getIncrement().

string Stochastic::getDescription (  )  [inline, virtual]

Get the name.

Returns the stochastic name

Reimplemented from Physical.
